title: SRB viability assay for Acanthamoeba castellanii

protocol.title: SRB viability assay for Acanthamoeba castellanii
protocol.title_html: SRB viability assay for Acanthamoeba castellanii

source.description:
Grow Acanthamoeba castellanii trophozoites in
in vented tissue culture-treated 75 cm2 cell culture flasks at
without shaking. Passage 1:80 every 3-4 days.

Add
to flasks and close lids tightly. Gently tap all surfaces of flasks on benchtop to dislodge trophozoites. Confirm complete detachment with light microscope at 100x. Move on to next step immediately, as trophozoites begin to reattach quickly (within 5 minutes).
Transfer media containing detached amoebas to a sterile 50-mL conical. Measure the volume using a sterile serological pipette and record (for cell count calculation).

Briefly vortex conical to ensure even suspension of cells and transfer
to a 1.5-mL microcentrifuge tube containing
. Mix by briefly vortexing and transfer
to hemocytometer.

Briefly vortex conical of trophozoites to dislodge attached cells. Transfer appropriate volume of cell suspension containing desired number of trophozoites to a new conical. Pellet cells by centrifuging at
(in 50-mL conical) or
(in 15-mL conical).
Gently decant media into waste container and resuspend cell pellet by briefly vortexting. Adjust volume with fresh PYG to a final cell concentration of 106 per mL.

Briefly vortex cells to dislodge attached trophozoites and ensure even suspension, then transfer to sterile liquid trough. Add
per well to sterile 96-well plates (clear, flat bottom, with lid).

source.body: Plates must be tissue culture-treated for experiments on cysts.

source.description:
Allow plates to sit at
for approximately
before further processing to ensure cells have attached to plates. Before removing media for additional steps, spin plates
for
.

source.body: Trophozoites are now ready for compound testing. To test compounds on cysts, proceed to steps 17 and 18.

source.description: Dissolve compounds in appropriate vehicle to desired concentration. DMSO, methanol, and ethanol are nontoxic to A. castellanii to a maximum of 1% final volume.
Add dissolved compounds to media. For cysts, use EMb. For trophozoites, use LB or PYG. Trophozoites will continue to divide in PYG but not in LB (nor will they encyst).

To induce encystment, remove media from wells and discard. Add
per well. Media must be added gently to walls of wells to prevent a jet of liquid from dislodging attached cells. Trophozoites can reattach, but cysts cannot.

source.body: (Do only if testing cysts)

source.description:
Remove spent PYG media from a monolayer of trophozoites. Wash cells with
, adding liquid to surface of flask opposite the cell layer to prevent dislodging adherent amoebas.
Count live cells and calculate total number of harvested amoebas. Determine total number of amoebas needed for experiment and calculate volume of cell suspension required.

Remove media from plates and discard. Add
per well, pipetting media gently to walls of wells to prevent a jet of liquid from dislodging attached cells.

Replace plate lid with breathable plate seal. Incubate at
without shaking for
. At end of encystment, spin plates
for
.

source.body: (Do only if testing cysts)

source.description:
Replace plate lid with breathable plate seal. Incubate at
without shaking for desired time.
At end of incubation, aspirate media and discard.

source.body: Alternatively, media can be removed by flicking off into waste container. Plates can also be washed with PBS-MC (either by pipetting or by submerging) before fixing, though this is not required for most test compounds. Plates can be fixed by submerging in TCA for faster processing.

If removing the media before fixing by flicking off into waste container, appropriate safety precautions must be taken as media may contain live amoebas—we suggest dumping plates into a wide basin containing bleach in a deep sink while wearing safety goggles, face shield, lab coat, and extended cuff gloves.

source.description:
Incubate plates for a minimum of
at
. Plates can be stored at
for several weeks.
Remove TCA by washing plates by submerging in plastic trays of tap water 4 times.

source.body: TCA is caustic. Appropriate PPE must be worn to prevent contact with skin or eyes.
Do not wash by running stream of tap water into plate wells. This results in uneven washing and can dislodge attached cells.

source.description:
Dissolve SRB dye in
to a final concentration of 4% (w/v). For each 96-well plate, use
in
.

source.body: SRB dye is light sensitive and should be stored in the dark at . We make it fresh for each experiment.

source.description:
Add
per well and incubate plates at
for
.

source.body: SRB dye solution has high surface tension. Make sure it has covered entire well bottom before incubating. Gently shaking the plate can ensure the liquid has covered the well bottom.

source.description:
Remove excess SRB dye by washing plates by submerging in plastic trays of
3 times. Gently shaking plates during submersion prevents air bubbles from excluding liquid, which can result in overstained wells. Contact time in acetic acid should be minimized to prevent overbleaching. Even washing of wells within and between experiments is critical for reproducible results. See video for example of technique.

source.body: We recommend changing first tray of acetic acid for each plate washed, and the second and third trays every other plate. This is because the majority of excess dye is removed with the first wash.
1% acetic acid is an irritant. Appropriate PPE must be worn to prevent contact with skin or eyes.

source.description:
Gently tap dry on paper towels and let air dry. Dried plates can be stored at
indefinitely.
Gently tap dry on paper towels and let air dry.

Solubilize SRB dye by adding
per well of
.

source.body: Precise pipetting is critical, as a change in volume will lead to a change in the concentration of solubilized SRB dye and the subsequent absorbance measurement.

source.description:
Incubate plate on orbital rocking platform for
at
.
Using a Kimwipe, remove any condensation from bottom of plate, top of lid, and inside lid. Measure the absorbance at 565 nm in a plate reader.

source.body: We use a Tecan Infinite M200 Pro plate reader with the following program: linear shake (1 mm amplitude) 30 seconds, wait 5 seconds, measure absorbance at 565 nm (25 flashes per read).

Trichloroacetic acid (TCA): make 100% (w/v) TCA by adding

bottle of TCA. Dilute to
in 1x PBS-MC. Store in glass container at

Prepare
acetic acid in dH2O in 10 or 20 L plastic carboy and store at

and store at
.

Add
per well. Add TCA gently to walls of wells to prevent dislodging attached cells.

description: Viability assay for Acanthamoeba castellanii trophozoites and cysts, which detects 1,000-100,000 cells.
